in_ports.name: input
in_ports.hint: Source grayscale matrix, on which we search for local maximums or minimums.

in_ports.name: mask
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] If specified, local extremums are searched only among the pixels, for which the corresponding pixels at this mask are non-zero.
Source values, for which the corresponding pixels at this mask are zero, are excluded from comparison.

in_ports.name: ignore
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] If specified, local extremums are excluded from the result, if the corresponding pixels at this matrix are non-zero.
Unlike the mask, this matrix does not affect to the comparison, it only allows to exclude some pixels from the final result.

out_ports.name: extremums
out_ports.hint: List of x/y-coordinates of all found local extremums

out_ports.caption: extremums mask
out_ports.name: extremums_mask
out_ports.hint:
[Optional] Binary matrix, containing 1 at all result extremums positions from "extremums" list,
dilated by circle, specified by "Result circle size" parameter (it is >1)

out_ports.caption: extremums on source
out_ports.name: extremums_on_source
out_ports.hint: [Optional] The "extremums mask" matrix, drawn by the specified color at the BLURRED and (if requested) CONTRASTED source matrix

controls.name: gaussianBlurKernelSize
controls.caption: Gaussian blur: kernel size
controls.description: If zero, blur is not performed

controls.name: apertureSize
controls.caption: Aperture size
controls.description: Diameter of the aperture to check maximum/minimum

controls.name: depthApertureSize
controls.caption: Alternative aperture size for measuring depth
controls.description: Diameter of the aperture to check opposite minimum/maximum. If zero or not set, the same aperture is tested.

controls.name: depthApertureRing
controls.caption: Alternative aperture is ring
controls.description: If set (even if alternative aperture size above is 0), the opposite minimum/maximum is checked ONLY at the circumference (ring), not inside the circle.

controls.name: minimalDepth
controls.caption: Minimal depth
controls.description: Minimal difference between the local maximum/minimum (M) and the opposite minimum/maximum (μ) in the same or alternative aperture. If the difference is less than this threshold, the local extremum is skipped.

controls.name: depthAnalysisMode
controls.caption: Mode of depth analysis
controls.description: How to calculate the opposite minimum/maximum (μ)

items.caption: Mean (faster than percentile, when it's level ≠1.0)

controls.name: depthPercentileLevel
controls.caption: Percentile level for depth
controls.description: If 1.0, the opposite extremum μ is really an exact minimum/maximum. If other value from 0 to 1, the opposite extremum μ is calculated as a percentile: 0.99 is almost minimum/maximum, 0.5 is median, 0.0 is maximum/minimum (last case makes sense for ring alternative aperture), etc. Note that values <1 essentially slow down the function. This parameter is ignored if mode of depth analysys is "Mean".

controls.name: resultAtPlateau
controls.caption: Result at plateau
controls.description: What to return as extremums, if near the local extremum there are several pixels with the equal value.

items.caption: All pixels at the plateu are returned
Centroid of all plateus are returned
Centroid of all plateus, dilated by the circle, are returned

controls.name: resultCircleSize
controls.caption: Result circle size
controls.description: Diameter of the circle, drawn at every found extremums. These circles are returned in "extremums mask" and used to find the positions of extremums in last variant of "Result at plateau"

controls.name: drawingExtremumsColor
controls.caption: Color for drawing extremums on source

controls.name: autoContrastSourceUnderExtremums
controls.caption: Automatically contrast source before drawing extremums
controls.description: If set, the blurred source matrix in "extremums on source" is automatically contrasted

controls.name: visibleExtremumsOnSource
controls.caption: Visible extremums on source
controls.description: If set, the visible result will be "extremums on source" instead of default "extremums mask" (see hint to "extremums on source")
